active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group debate, argue for or against implementing digital badges for all visitors versus traditional paper badges, considering cybersecurity risks (e.g., spoofing), cost, convenience, and alignment with NIST CSF Protect function.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Teach-back exercise: One student explains VMS components (pre-registration, check-in, escort, log-out) and their NIST relationships to a partner, who then summarizes with a personal or hypothetical workplace example and receives feedback.
active_learning.problem_solving: Real-world scenario: A delivery person tails a visitor into a secure area, leading to a data breach. In teams, design a step-by-step prevention protocol using NIST CSF Protect and Detect functions, including logging and response measures.

additional_activities.activity: Role-playing simulation: Pairs act out a visitor check-in process with one as receptionist and one as visitor; peers provide feedback on security gaps.
Think-pair-share: Identify the riskiest visitor types (e.g., contractors vs. VIPs) and justify using risk analysis from NIST SP 800-37 Rev. 2.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Visitor Management under Security Awareness and Training. Use the provided topic hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Security Awareness and Training > Security Controls and Best Practices > Workplace Security Practices > Visitor Management. **Full Research Context:** Visitor management ensures non-employees (visitors: contractors, clients, etc.) are identified, screened, and managed for physical/digital access. Core: VMS (pre-registration, ID verification, badges, escorts, logging, NDAs, revocation). Risks: tailgating, social engineering. NIST CSF (Identify: assets/threats; Protect: access controls; Detect: monitoring; Respond/Recover/Govern: incident handling/policy). NIST SP 800-37 Rev. 2 RMF: Prepare (org-level), Categorize (system), Select (controls e.g., SP 800-53 AC-2/PE-3), Implement, Assess, Authorize, Monitor. Best practices: photo ID, background checks, CCTV integration, AI VMS. Sources: NIST CSF (https://www.nist.gov/cyberframework), SP 800-37 Rev. 2 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/37/r2/final), SP 800-53 Rev. 5 (https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final). **Concept Map:** Central: Visitor Management → VMS (branches: pre-reg, check-in, etc.) → Risk Mitigation → NIST CSF (Identify→Protect→Detect) → RMF Steps. Incorporate these learning objectives [insert learning_objectives array], active learning [reference activities for scenario questions], and 4 scaffolding layers [insert scaffolding_layers array]. Generate 25 flashcards using the exact schema: {question, options: ['A. ...', 'B. ...', etc.], correct_answer: 'A (explanation with NIST ref, why distractors wrong)', explanation, bloom_level, scaffolding_layer, topic_hierarchy}. Follow distractor protocol strictly. Ensure flashcards progress pedagogy: foundation questions first, then build to integration/create. Balance Bloom's levels. Output as JSON array of objects.
